intro: Brachystele polyantha, commonly known as the small-stemmed star-flowered plant, is a rare and delicate member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with a fine pubescence. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Brachystele polyantha is considered a challenging plant to cultivate outside its natural range.
